Name:
Cygnet
St. Laurent
Identification:
Pennant number: H83
Pennant number: H83
Fate:
Sold to the Royal Canadian Navy, 1 February 1937
Scrapped in 1947
Displacement:
1,375 long tons (1,397 t) (standard)
1,865 long tons (1,895 t) (deep)
Propulsion:
2 × shafts
2 × Parsons geared steam turbines
3 × Admiralty 3-drum boilers
Range: 5,500 nmi (10,200 km; 6,300 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × 1 - QF 4.7-inch Mk IX guns
1 × 1 - QF 3-inch 20 cwt anti-aircraft gun
2 × 1 - QF 2-pounder Mk II AA guns
2 × 4 - 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
6 × depth charges, 3 chutes
